div.p: This implementation guide defines the use of FHIR R4 resources to exchange Real Time Location Services (RTLS) information that indicates where patients, staff, devices, or other assets are located within a hospital or other healthcare facility.

RTLS systems use tags that are assigned to the subject being tracked and communicate their location in real time using a sensory network within a facility. This location data is typically exchanged between a RTLS system and hospital EHR system and has many applications such as workflow automation, staff/asset tracking, and patient monitoring.
The scope of this implementation guide includes support for workflows related to the implementation of a RTLS system. This includes the following:

ul.li: Tag assignment and unassignment for patients, staff, or devices
Addition and removal of tags from circulation
